original: Paṭṭhānapakaraṇa
analyzed: paṭṭhāna pakaraṇa
translated: (The method of exposition in the Paṭṭhāna is as follows:🔽The first section is the “Triad” (tika), which is the exposition of the three roots of profit, etc., in the three planes.🔽The second section is the “Duka” (duka), which is the exposition of the profitable, etc., in the three planes.

original: Dhammānulomapaccanīya (3), Tikadukapaṭṭhānapāḷi (4)
analyzed: dhamma anuloma paccanīya tika duka paṭṭhāna pāḷi
translated: The third section is the “Triad-duka” (tikaduka), which is the exposition of the profitable, etc., in the three planes.🔽The fourth section is the “Triad-duka-reversal” (tikadukapaṭṭhāna), which is the exposition of the unprofitable, etc., in the three planes.

original: 16.25. Kusalattika, Piṭṭhiduka🔽Akusalaṁ dassanena pahātabbaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naakusalo nadassanena pahātabbo dhammo🔽uppajjati hetupaccayā. Akusalaṁ dassanena pahātabbaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nakusalo nadassanena
analyzed: kusalattika piṭṭhiduka  akusalam dassanena pahātabbam dhammam paṭicca na akusalaḥ na dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ  uppajjati hetu paccayā akusalam dassanena pahātabbam dhammam paṭicca na kusalaḥ na dassanena
translated: The fifth section is the “Duka-reversal” (piṭṭhiduka), which is the exposition of the unprofitable, etc., in the three planes.🔽The sixth section is the “Triad-duka-reversal-reversal” (piṭṭhidukapaṭṭhāna), which is the exposition of the profitable, etc., in the three planes.🔽The seventh section is the “Triad-reversal” (piṭṭhītika), which is the exposition of the unprofitable, etc., in the three planes.

original: pahātabbo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Akusalaṁ dassanena pahātabbaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca
analyzed: pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā akusalam dassanena pahātabbam dhammam paṭicca
translated: The eighth section is the “Triad-reversal-reversal” (piṭṭhītikappaṭṭhāna), which is the exposition of the profitable, etc., in the three planes.🔽The ninth section is the “Duka-reversal” (piṭṭhiduka), which is the exposition of the unprofitable, etc., in the three planes.

original: nakusalo nadassanena pahātabbo ca naakusalo nadassanena pahātabbo ca dhammā uppajjanti🔽hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: na kusalaḥ na dassanena pahātabbo ca na akusalaḥ na dassanena pahātabbo ca dhammā uppajjanti  hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi
translated: The tenth section is the “Duka-reversal-reversal” (piṭṭhidukappaṭṭhāna), which is the exposition of the profitable, etc., in the three planes.🔽The eleventh section is the “Triad-duka-reversal-reversal” (piṭṭhītikadukapaṭṭhāna), which is the exposition of the unprofitable, etc., in the three planes.🔽The twelfth section is the “Triad-duka-reversal-reversal-reversal” (piṭṭhītikadukappaṭṭhāna), which is the exposition of the profitable, etc., in the three planes.

original: Abyākataṁ nadassanena pahātabbaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā naabyākato nanadassanena pahātabbo🔽dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Abyākataṁ nadassanena pahātabbaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā nakusalo
analyzed: abyākatam na dassanena pahātabbam dhammam paccayā na abyākataḥ na na dassanena pahātabbo 🔽dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā abyākatam na dassanena pahātabbam dhammam paccayā na kusalaḥ
translated: The thirteenth section is the “Triad-duka-

original: nanadassanena pahātabbo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Abyākataṁ nadassanena pahātabbaṁ
analyzed: na na dassanena pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā abyākatam na dassanena pahātabba
translated: A factor that is to be given up by seeing is a condition, as condition being a root, for a neutral factor that is not to be given up by seeing.🔽A neutral factor that is not to be given up by seeing is a condition, as condition being a root, for a skillful factor that is to be given up by seeing and for a neutral factor that is not to be given up by seeing.

original: dhammaṁ paccayā nakusalo nanadassanena pahātabbo ca naabyākato nanadassanena pahātabbo
analyzed: dhammam paccayā na kusalaḥ nana dassanena pahātabbo ca na abyākataḥ nana dassanena pahātabbo
translated: A neutral factor that is not to be given up by seeing is a condition, as condition being a root, for a skillful factor that is to be given up by seeing and for a neutral factor that is not to be given up by seeing.

original: ca dhammā uppajjanti hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.🔽Akusalaṁ bhāvanāya pahātabbaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca naakusalo nabhāvanāya pahātabbo dhammo🔽uppajjati hetupaccayā. Akusalaṁ bhāvanāya pahātabbaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nakusalo nabhāvanāya
analyzed: ca dhammā uppajjanti hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi  akusalam bhāvanāya pahātabbam dhammam paṭicca na akusalaḥ na bhāvanāya pahātabbaḥ dhammaḥ  uppajjati hetu paccayā akusalam bhāvanāya pahātabbam dhammam paṭicca na kusalaḥ na bhāvanāya
translated: A skillful factor that is to be given up by development is a condition, as condition being a root, for a skillful factor that is not to be given up by development.🔽A skillful factor that is to be given up by development is a condition, as condition being a root, for a neutral factor that is not to be given up by development.🔽A skillful factor that is to be given up by development is a condition, as condition being a root, for a neutral factor that is not to be given up by development.

original: pahātabbo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. Akusalaṁ bhāvanāya pahātabbaṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca🔽nakusalo nabhāvanāya pahātabbo ca naakusalo nabhāvanāya pahātabbo ca dhammā uppajjanti

translated: A skillful factor that is to be given up by development is a condition, as condition being a root, for a skillful factor that is not to be given up by development and for a neutral factor that is not to be given up by development.

translated: With a wholesome thought not accompanied by thinking as condition, there is a wholesome thought not accompanied by thinking … (abbreviated). (The rest of the section is to be elaborated in detail as for the wholesome.)

translated: With root-cause as condition, an unwholesome, unassociated with equanimity, idea arises. (In brief:) With root-cause as condition, there are thirteen. With object as condition, there are nine. … With result as condition, there are three. … With nonequipoise as condition, there are thirteen.🔽With root-cause as condition, an unwholesome, unassociated with equanimity, idea arises. (In brief:) With root-cause as condition, there are nine. … With result as condition, there are three. … With nonequipoise as condition, there are nine.

original: Abyākataṁ kāmāvacaraṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nakusalo nakāmāvacaro dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā tīṇi …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: abyākatam kāmāvacaram dhammam paṭicca na kusalaḥ na kāmāvacaraḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā tīṇi pe avigate tīṇi
translated: With an unwholesome idea belonging to the sense sphere as condition, a wholesome idea belonging to the sense sphere arises. (In brief:) With root-cause as condition, there are three. … With nonequipoise as condition, there are three.

original: Kusalaṁ nakāmāvacaraṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca nakusalo nanakāmāvacaro dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: kusalam na kāmāvacaram dhammam paṭicca na kusalaḥ na na kāmāvacaraḥ dhammo uppajjati hetu paccayā
translated: With a wholesome idea belonging to the sense sphere as condition, a wholesome idea belonging to the sense sphere arises.

original: (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā cha, adhipatiyā cha …pe… aññamaññe tīṇi …pe… vipāke tīṇi …pe… avigate cha.
analyzed: saṅkhitta hetuyā cha adhipatiyā cha pe aññamaññe tīṇi pe vipāke tīṇi pe avigate cha
translated: (In brief:) With root-cause as condition, there are six. With predominance as condition, there are six. … With mutual condition, there are three. … With result as condition, there are three. … With nonequipoise as condition, there are six.

translated: With a wholesome leading-out as condition, there arises a unwholesome non-leading-out. (In brief.) With a cause as condition, there are three … With an oblivious as condition, there are three.
